summary: This bill, the Safeguarding Testing and Overdose Prevention Against Fentanyl and Xylazine Act (STOP Fentanyl and Xylazine Act), aims to clarify that the possession, sale, purchase, importation, exportation, or transportation of drug testing equipment designed to detect the presence of fentanyl or xylazine is not unlawful. The bill amends the Controlled Substances Act to this effect, aiming to increase access to testing tools to combat the opioid crisis.
